"Notes": Vendor-provided numeric event defined by the vendor representing the source message type, e.g. EventCode/Event ID for Microsoft
The actual time of the event in the message or the time the event message was generated
Length of time in seconds for the event being described
The timestamp value for when the event described in the log message had ended
Vendor-provided error code associated with the current message
Description of error associated with the current message
Hostname or FQDN of a system such as an IDS or IPS that generates an message (such as an alert) based on inspection of a thing, such as network traffic.
IP address of the event observer
Unique identifier (such as a serial number) associated with the event observer
The time an event was recieved by an intermediate/centralized system prior to being sent to Graylog
Count of times a message has been repeated, commonly provided by log creator/processor
Host or IP of system that delivered the message to Graylog - a WEC server, syslog collector, etc.
Source system that generated the event message
API version of source where logs are collected via API
System responsible for generating the event, e.g. “windows”, “okta”, etc.
The timestamp value for when the event described in the log message started
Unique identification associated with a single event/message (e.g, “record number” from Windows event logs, a Graylog message ID)
